tuv.seg: As a victim of crime, you may be entitled to compensation for what has happened to you
D'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh cúiteamh ar fáil don té atá thíos le coir
There are 2 types of compensation for victims
Tá dhá chineál chúitimh ar fáil do dhuine atá ina íobartach
In some cases, the court may decide that an offender must pay compensation to you
Is féidir le cúirt, i gcásanna áirid, cinneadh a dhéanamh nach mór don chiontóir cúiteamh a íoc leis an íobartach
This may be one of a number of conditions that the court has imposed on the offender so that he or she can avoid a prison sentence
D'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh an t-ordú seo tugtha i measc orduithe eile nach mór don chiontóir a chomhlíonadh le téarma príosúin a sheachaint
The court may ask the Probation Service to supervise the payment of the compensation
D'fhéadfadh an Chúirt iarraidh ar an tSeirbhís Phromhaidh Leasa agus cinntiú go bhfuil an cúiteamh íoctha
Scheme of Compensation for Personal Injuries Criminally Inflicted
Scéim Cúitimh ar son Gortuithe Pearsanta Gearrtha go Coiriúil
If you are injured as a result of a crime, you may be eligible for compensation under the Scheme of Compensation for Personal Injuries Criminally Inflicted
Má tá duine gortaithe de bharr coire d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh cúiteamh tugtha dó/dí faoin Scéim Cúitimh ar son Gortuithe Pearsanta Gearrtha go Coiriúil
This scheme is funded by the Department of Justice and Equality and administered by the Criminal Injuries Compensation Tribunal
Tá an scéim seo maoinithe ag An Roinn Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais agus is é Binse Cúitimh na nGortuithe Coiriúla a dhéanann an scéim a riaradh
Compensation in cross-border cases
Cúiteamh i gcásanna trasteorann

If you are injured as a result of a crime while visiting another EU member state, you should contact the Criminal Injuries Compensation Tribunal for advice on making a claim for compensation to the member state where the incident took place

Má tá tú gortaithe mar gheall ar choir agus iad ar cuairt ballstát eile den AE, ba chóir duit dul i dteagmháil leis an Binse Cúitimh i leith Díobhálacha Coiriúla chun comhairle a fháil ar éileamh ar chúiteamh chuig an mballstát inar tharla an eachtra ar siúl
There is more information on the Tribunal's website
Tá tuilleadh eolais ar shuíomh idirlín an Bhinse
What does the scheme of compensation cover?
Céard Atá Clúdaithe Faoin Scéim?
The scheme pays compensation for expenses and losses suffered
Íocann an scéim cúiteamh ar son costas agus cailliúintí a thit ar dhuine
• As a direct result of a violent crime or
• mar thoradh díreach ar choir fhoréigneach
• While assisting or trying to assist in preventing a crime or saving a human life
• a bhí ag tabhairt cúnamh nó ag iarraidh cúnamh a thabhairt le coir a stopadh nó le beatha duine a shábhailt
Who can claim compensation?
Cé hIad Na Daoine Gur Féidir Leo Cúiteamh A Éileamh?
The injured person (the victim) or, if that person has died, the immediate family of the victim can claim compensation under the scheme
Is féidir leis an duine atá gortaithe (an t-íobartach) nó, má tá an duine sin básaithe, teaghlach an íobartaigh cúiteamh a éileamh faoin scéim
If you are responsible for looking after the victim and are out-of-pocket as a result of his or her injuries, you may claim compensation
Má tá duine freagrach as breathnú i ndiaidh an íobartaigh agus má thit costais air/uirthi de bharr gortaithe a d'fhulaing an íobartaigh is féidir leis an duine sin cúiteamh a éileamh
Time limit for making a claim
Teorann Ama le hÉileamh a Dhéanamh
There is no time limit for making a claim in cases where the victim has died as a result of the injury inflicted, in all other cases the time limit for making a claim is three months
Ní mór éileamh a dhéanamh taobh istigh de 3 mhí
However, sometimes the tribunal will not impose the time limit if you can give a reasonable explanation for the delay
Ach, amanta ní chuirfidh an binse an teorann ama i bhfeidhm más féidir míniú sásúil a thabhairt ar an moill cúiteamh a éileamh
In all cases, the tribunal will look for a Garda report on the crime
Beidh an binse ag iarraidh tuairisc a fháil i gcónaí ó na Gardaí ar an gcoir
The crime should be reported to the Gardai as soon as possible
Ba cheart an choir a chur in iúl do na Gardaí chomh luath agus is féidir
If you leave too long a delay in reporting the crime you may not be considered for compensation unless the tribunal is happy that you have co-operated fully with the Gardai

Má bhíonn achar fada ann ó tharla an choir go dtí go dtéann duine chuig na Gardaí ní íocfar aon chúiteamh ach amháin sa chás go bhfuil an binse sásta gur chabhraigh an t-éilitheoir go hiomlán leis na Gardaí
You do not need legal representation when you apply for compensation
Ní gá do dhuine ionadaí dlí a bheith aige/aici le cúiteamh a éileamh
The tribunal will not pay your legal expenses
Ní íocfaidh an binse as costais dlí a thiteann ar dhuine
Usually, your application will be dealt with on the basis of your application form and you do not have to actually appear in front of the tribunal
Go hiondúil pléifear iarratas ar chúiteamh le foirm iarratais agus ní gá don éilitheoir teacht ós comhair binse go pearsanta
If your claim is for less than €317, the Secretary of the Tribunal can deal with it
Más éileamh de níos lú ná £250 (317.43 euro) is féidir le Rúnaí an Bhinse deileáil leis
Appealing the decision of the tribunal
Achomharc a Dhéanamh ar Chinneadh an Bhinse
If the original decision was made by the Secretary of the Tribunal, you can appeal that decision to a single member of the tribunal
Más é Rúnaí an Bhinse a rinne an cinneadh is féidir achomharc a dhéanamh ós comhair baill amháin den bhinse
If you are unhappy with the decision of a single member of the tribunal, you may appeal it to an informal hearing by 3 members of the tribunal
Muna bhfuil an t-éilitheoir sásta le cinneadh baill amháin den bhinse is féidir achomharc neamhfhoirmialta a lorg ós comhair triúr baill den bhinse
You must present your case before the tribunal, although you may have legal representation at your own expense if you wish
Is féidir le éilitheoir a c(h)ás féin a chur ós comhair an bhinse ach is féidir freisin ionadaíocht dlí a bheith aige/aici ach an costas sin a íoc é/í féin
The decision of the 3-member tribunal is final
Níl aon dul thar chinneadh a dhéanann triúr bhall den bhinse
No compensation will be paid
Ní íocfar aon chúiteamh
• if the loss is less than €63.49
• más cailliúint de níos lú ná 63.49 euro a bhí i gceist
• if you and the assailant were living together as part of the same household when you suffered the injury
• má bhí an t-éilitheoir agus an t-ionsaitheoir ina gcónaí in éineacht mar chuid den líon tí chéanna nuair a tharla an gortú
• if your injury is the result of a traffic offence, unless the tribunal decides that there was a deliberate attempt to run you down
• má bhain an gortú le coir thráchta, ach amháin sa chás go bhfuil an binse sásta gur rinneadh iarracht d'aon turas an t-éilitheoir a leagan
• if you do not give reasonable assistance to the tribunal
• muna dtugann an t-éilitheoir cúnamh réasúnta don Bhinse
How much compensation will be awarded?
Cé Mhéid Cúitimh a Thabharfar?
The scheme only covers out-of-pocket expenses and bills
Íocann an scéim seo as costais agus billí amháin a thit ar dhuine
It doesn't compensate you for pain and suffering
Níl aon chúiteamh ar fáil as pian ná fulaingt
When deciding the amount of the award, the tribunal will consider any social welfare payments, salary or wages you received while on sick leave from work

Nuair atá cinneadh le déanamh faoi mhéid an chúitimh, cuirfidh an binse san áireamh aon íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh, tuarastal nó pá a fuair an t-éilitheoir agus é/í as láthair ón obair de bharr tinnis
The tribunal will also take into account any compensation paid by or on behalf of the assailant
Cuirfidh an binse san áireamh freisin aon chúiteamh a d'íoc an t-ionsaitheoir nó a íocadh ar son an ionsaitheora
The tribunal may reduce the amount of compensation or give no compensation at all if it decides that you were partly or wholly to blame for the incident, for example, if you provoked the incident

Is féidir leis an mbinse an cúiteamh a ísliú nó gan aon chúiteamh a íoc in aon chor má shochraíonn sé go raibh baint ag an éilitheoir leis an eachtra nó gurb é/í ba chiontach as, mar shampla má spreag sé/sí an t-ionsaí
It may also reduce the amount of compensation because of your behaviour, character or way of life
Is féidir freisin méid an chúitimh a ísliú de bharr iompair, tréithe nó saol an éilitheora
If you have a criminal record, it can be taken into account
Má bhí an t-éilitheoir cúisithe cheana le coireanna coiriúla is féidir é sin a chur san áireamh
There are five types of cases
Tá cúig chineál cásanna ann
Personal injuries with short-term effects
Gortuithe Pearsanta le Tionchair Ghearrthéarmacha

You will be paid for your actual loss of earnings (because you had to take time off work), actual medical expenses (including dentist's expenses), reasonable traveling expenses (e.g., going to and from the doctor), medication and eyeglasses

Íocfar an duine as an ioncam a chaill sé/sí (mar gheall ar an am saor ón obair a thóg sé/sí), costais leighis a d'íoc sé/sí (costais fhiaclóra san áireamh), costais réasúnta taistil (mar shampla taisteal chuig agus ón dochtúir), cógas leighis agus speaclaí
Personal injuries with long-term effects
Gortuithe Pearsanta le Tionchair Fhadthéarmacha

You will be paid for your estimated future loss of earnings (how much you would have earned if you had been able to continue working), estimated future medical expenses, estimated future expenses as a result of the disability (e.g., future care or special equipment) and estimated future loss of earning potential

Íocfar an duine as an ioncam measta a chaillfidh sé/sí amach anseo (an méid ioncaim a bheadh aige/aici dá mbeadh sé/sí in ann coinneáil air/uirthi ag obair), as na costais leighis mheasta a thitfidh air/uirthi, as na costais mheasta a thitfidh air/uirthi de bharr míchumais (e.g., cúram amach anseo nó trealamh speisialta) agus as an ioncam measta go bhféadfadh duine a bheith aige/aici amach anseo
Death of the victim due to criminal injury
Bás an Íobartaigh de bharr Gortaithe Choiriúil

The family will be paid the actual loss of earnings and expenses that may have been incurred before the death, future loss of support or maintenance for anyone who was dependent on the victim, funeral and burial expenses and mental distress money for immediate family members

Íocfar an teaghlach as aon ioncam agus costais a bhí ag dul chuig an duine a maraíodh roimh a b(h)ás, as cailliúintí tacaíochta nó cothabhála ar son aon chleithiúnach a bhí ag an íobartach, as costais a bhaineann le sochraid agus leis an duine a chur, chomh maith le híocaíocht ar son struis ar bhaill den theaghlach gar
Death of the victim not due to the criminal injury
Bás an Íobartaigh nach raibh Gortú Coiriúil ag Baint leis
If the victim died of causes unrelated to the criminal injury, the family will not be compensated unless the tribunal considers that this would cause hardship to the dependants of the victim

Má cailleadh an t-íobartach de bharr cúiseanna nach mbaineann leis an ngortú coiriúil ní bheidh aon chúiteamh le n-íoc leis an teaghlach ach amháin sa chás go measann an binse go mbeadh sé seo crua ar chleithiúnaigh an íobartaigh
Stolen or damaged property
Maoin Goidthe nó Damáiste a bheith déanta dó
The scheme does not compensate for stolen or damaged property, except medically necessary items like eyeglasses and artificial limbs
Níl aon chúiteamh faoin scéim seo ar fáil do mhaoin a goideadh nó ar déanadh damáiste dó, ach amháin i gcás rudaí a bhfuil gá leighis ag baint leo ar nós speaclaí agus géaga bréige
How is compensation paid?
Cén Chaoi a nDéantar Cúiteamh a Íoc?
Usually the money is paid in a single payment
Go hiondúil íoctar an t-airgead in aon sciar amháin
However, there are exceptions:
Ach, tá eisceachtaí ann:
• The tribunal may make an initial payment and postpone the final award until it becomes clearer what the long-term effect of an injury is likely to be
• Is féidir le binse íocaíocht amháin a dhéanamh agus an íocaíocht dheireanach a chur ar athló go dtí go bhfuil sé soiléar cén tionchar fadthéarmach a bheidh ag an ngortú
• If you are under 18 years old, the tribunal may invest the money until you become an adult
• Má tá an t-íobartach faoi 18 is féidir leis an mbinse cinneadh a dhéanamh an t-airgead a infheistiú go mbeidh an duine sin fásta
• If you are no longer able to manage your affairs, the tribunal may have the money placed in a trust for your benefit
• Muna bhfuil an t-íobartach in ann breathnú i ndiaidh a c(h)uid gnó féin is féidir an t-airgead a chur in iontabhas ar a s(h)on
You can download the Fatal Injury Application Form or the Non-Fatal Application Form from the Tribunal's website
Is féidir leat a íoslódáil an Fhoirm Iarratais Díobhála Marfacha nó an Fhoirm Iarratais Neamh-Mharfacha ó láithreán gréasáin an Bhinse
You can phone or write to the Offices of the Tribunal, giving your name and address and the date and location of the incident, and an application form will be sent to you
Is féidir leat glaoch ar nó scríobh chuig Oifigí an Bhinse, le ainm agus seoladh an íobartaigh chomh maith leis an dáta agus an áit ar tharla an eachtra, agus beidh foirm iarratais a sheoladh chugat
You should fill out the application form and return it to the tribunal
Ba chóir duit a líonadh amach an fhoirm iarratais agus seol ar ais chuig an mBinse
You should send any receipts or vouchers for expenses along with the form
Ba cheart aon admhálacha nó dearbháin ar chostais a chur ar ais leis an bhfoirm iarratais
Information on the compensation scheme (pdf) is available in the Criminal Injuries Compensation Tribunal Victims Charter (pdf)
Tá eolas ar an scéim chúitimh (pdf) ar fáil sna Díobhálacha Coiriúla Cairt Íospartach an Bhinse Cúitimh (pdf)
